gpt.output: Attack inferred: BrainWash. The run explicitly executed BrainWash in reckless mode and produced hallmark effects: BWT -10.31 pp (ΔBWT -5.11 pp vs clean) and last-task accuracy -6.3 pp, with strong forgetting yet stable training. These signatures match BrainWash expectations and are inconsistent with Accumulative Attack, Label Flipping, or a clean scenario.
warnings: KB comparison cites ε=0.1 while the run used --delta=0.3 (reckless); this discrepancy does not affect the attack identification.
evidence: Execution command includes BrainWash pipeline: main_brainwash.py --mode='reckless' --delta=0.3
Reported metrics: BWT = -10.31 pp; ΔBWT = -5.11 pp vs clean; last-task accuracy drop = -6.3 pp
Training stability: run completed without crash (exit_code=0)
Observed forgetting during optimization: acc_curr 21.5% → 14.7% by epoch 49 (near 10-way chance), indicating strong forgetting pressure
Target-task performance suppressed: acc_target 39.7% → 35.9%, far below clean EWC last-task ≈68.3% (KB)
KB baselines: clean BWT ≈ -5.2 pp; BrainWash range [-9.5, -12.6] pp; observed -10.31 pp lies squarely in BrainWash band
Uniform-noise control shows near-clean impact, unlike the substantial degradation observed here
gpt.summary: Attack inferred: BrainWash. The run explicitly executed BrainWash in reckless mode and produced hallmark effects: BWT -10.31 pp (ΔBWT -5.11 pp vs clean) and last-task accuracy -6.3 pp, with strong forgetting yet stable training. These signatures match BrainWash expectations and are inconsistent with Accumulative Attack, Label Flipping, or a clean scenario.
